questions: Q. 6. Who discovered mitosis?
answers: Ans. Flemming (1882)

questions: Q. 7. Who is premitosis or intranuclear mitosis ?
answers: Ans. Genome is a one set of DNA instruction or single set of chromosome in a cell.

questions: Q. 9. Which type of cell division helps in regeneration?
answers: Ans. Mitosis, because it keeps all the somatic cells of an organism genetically similar, so that they are able to regenerate a part or whole of the organism.

questions: Q. 10. Name the chemical that arrests the cell division in cells.
answers: Ans. The two chemicals that arrest the cell division in a cell are (i) Colchicine (ii) Cyanides.

questions: Q. 11. What is a kinetochore ?
answers: Ans. Kinetochore is a part of a chromosome for the attachment of chromosomal fibres.

questions: Q. 12. How do cell stop dividing?
answers: Ans. When cell enters in G 0 cycle.

questions: Q. 13. Name the forces which help in chromosomal movement during cell division.
answers: Ans. Contraction of chromosome fibres, formation and expansion of interzonal fibres and poleward dissolution of microtubules of chromosome fibres..

questions: Q. 14. What are kinetochores ?
answers: Ans. Small disc-shaped structures at the surface of the centromeres which serve as the sites of attachment of spindle fibres are called as kinetochores.

questions: Q. 15. When does syncytium condition takes place?
answers: Ans. When nuclear division takes place without cytoplasmic division it results in the formation of large number of nuclei in a cell. This condition is called syncytium.

questions: Q. 16. Name the enzymes which help in breakage and reunion of chromatids.
answers: Ans. Enzyme that help in breakage is endonuclease and enzyme that help in reunion is Rprotein.

questions: Q. 17. What is a metaphase plate?
answers: Ans. It is an imaginary plane perpendicular to the spindle fibers of a dividing cell, along which chromosomes align during metaphase.

questions: Q. 18. What is nucleocytoplasmic ratio ?
answers: Ans. It is a ratio of the size (i.e. volume) of the nucleus of a cell to the size to the cytoplasm of that cell.

questions: Q. 19. What is the average cell cycle span for a mammalian cell ?
answers: Ans. 24 hours is average duration.

questions: Q. 20. Name the longest and shortest phase of mitosis ?
answers: Ans. Prophase has longest duration, while anaphase has the shortest duration.

questions: Q. 21. By which method cytokinesis occurs in an animal cell ?
answers: Ans. By furrowing.

questions: Q. 22. What do you understand by synaptonemal complex?
answers: Ans. It is made up of two lateral arms and a medium element, which forms pairing of homologous chromosomes.

questions: Q. 23. What Is generation time ?
answers: Ans. The time interval between two cell cycles is called generation time.

questions: Q. 24. Name the point from which colchicine is extracted.
answers: Ans. It is extracted from colchicum autumnale.

questions: Q. 25. In Which stage of cell division chromosome are seen best?
answers: Ans. At metaphase stage, as they are shortest and thickest.

questions: Q. 26. Complete the following figure for cell cycle.
answers: Ans. a → G0 , b → S, c → G2

questions: Q. 27. Why is meiosis known as "Reduction Division'? What is its significance?
answers: Ans. Meiosis is called as reduction division because the chromosome number gets reduced to its half. It helps in producing haploid gametes in sexually reproducing organisms.

questions: Q. 28. Name the phase of meiosis I which is characterized by the appearance of recombination nodules?
answers: Ans. Pachytene.

questions: Q. 29. Name the cells where mitosis and meiosis occur.
answers: Ans. Mitosis occurs in somatic cell whereas meiosis occurs in diploid.

questions: Q. 30. Why is meiosis called the reductional division whereas mitotic division is called as equational division?
answers: Ans. Meiosis is called as reductional division because the chromosome number gets reduced to its half whereas mitosis is equational division because the chromosome number remains the same after division.

questions: Q. 31. What are interzonal fibres ?
answers: Ans. The protein fibres are formed in between the centromeres of homologous chromosomes during metaphase I stage of meiosis are called interzonal fibres.

questions: Q. 32. Define crossing over.
answers: Ans. Crossing over is the exchange of genetic material between the non-sister chromatids of homologous chromosomes during pachytene of prophase.

questions: Q. 33. What are dyads?
answers: Ans. The separated chromosomes are called dyads.

questions: Q. 34. What do you understand by synaptonemal complex ?
answers: Ans. It is made up of two lateral arms and a medium element, which forms pairing of homologous chromosomes.

questions: Q. 35. Name three types of life cycles on the basis of meiosis.
answers: Ans. On this basis, of meiosis, life cycles are- diplontic, haplontic and diplo-haplontic.

questions: Q. 36. Name the enzyme on which the process of crossing over is dependent.
answers: Ans. Recombinase
